identity.name: QuickChat
identity.core_philosophy: Communication at the speed of light in a vacuum. No distractions, just pure signal.

headings.usage: Use for all section headers, modal titles, and hero text. Tracking tight (-0.02em).

body.usage: Use for chat messages, inputs, and metadata. High legibility is key.

mono.usage: Use for timestamps, code snippets, and encryption keys.

avatars.style: Rounded-full with a 2px border. Border color indicates status (Green=Online, etc).

accessibility.contrast: Ensure all text has at least 4.5:1 contrast ratio against the dark background.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus rings (2px solid primary color) on all interactive elements.
accessibility.aria: Use aria-labels for icon-only buttons (e.g., 'Send Message', 'Attach File').

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Install 'lucide-react' for icons, 'framer-motion' for animations, and 'clsx'/'tailwind-merge' for class management.
2. THEME: Implement the dark theme by default. Do not rely on system preference initially; force the 'dark' class on the html/body tag.
3. LAYOUT: Build a responsive layout. On mobile, the sidebar should be a drawer/sheet. On desktop, it's persistent.
4. CHAT: Ensure the chat window scrolls to bottom automatically on new message. Use a virtual list if expecting many messages (optional for MVP).
5. AUTH: Create a stunning login page using the 'auth_background' image with a glassmorphic form overlay.
6. COMPONENTS: Customize Shadcn components to match the 'Cyber-Noir' aesthetic. Remove default white backgrounds and replace with dark glass.
7. CRITICAL: Do not use 'Inter' font. Load 'Outfit' and 'Manrope' from Google Fonts in the index.html or CSS.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§ ðŸ’­ðŸ’¡ðŸ”® etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed.
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
Use 'sonner' for toasts. Sonner component are located in '/app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx'.
